intro: Gordonia bidoupensis, commonly known as the Bidoup mountain evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Vietnam, particularly in the Bidoup-Nui Ba National Park. This evergreen shrub or small tree is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in forest understories. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
